dt: {bc}the process of forming an opinion or evaluation by {d_link|discerning|discern} and comparing

dt.t: is not worth doing in my {wi}judgment{/wi}

dt: {bc}a formal utterance of an authoritative opinion
{bc}a formal decision given by a court
{bc}an obligation (such as a debt) created by the decree of a court
{bc}the final judging of humankind by God
{bc}a calamity held to be sent by God

dt.t: believed their bad luck to be a {wi}judgment{/wi} upon them

dt: {bc}a proposition stating something believed or asserted

pt: {sc}sense{/sc} {sc}common sense{/sc} {sc}judgment{/sc} {sc}wisdom{/sc} mean ability to reach intelligent conclusions. {sc}sense{/sc} implies a reliable ability to judge and decide with soundness, prudence, and intelligence.
{sc}common sense{/sc} suggests an average degree of such ability without sophistication or special knowledge.
{sc}judgment{/sc} implies sense tempered and refined by experience, training, and maturity.

pt.t: they relied on her {it}judgment{/it} for guidance

pt: {sc}wisdom{/sc} implies sense and judgment far above average.

shortdef: the process of forming an opinion or evaluation by discerning and comparing
an opinion or estimate so formed
a subjective decision, ruling, or opinion

dt: {bc}the day of God's judgment of humankind at the end of the world according to various theologies

shortdef: the day of God's judgment of humankind at the end of the world according to various theologies

dt: {bc}the judgment of humankind before God at the end of the world

shortdef: the judgment of humankind before God at the end of the world

dt: {bc}judgment that may be granted upon a party's motion when the pleadings, discovery, and any affidavits show that there is no issue of material fact and that the party is entitled to judgment in its favor as a matter of law

shortdef: judgment that may be granted upon a party's motion when the pleadings, discovery, and any affidavits show that there is no issue of material fact and that the party is entitled to judgment in its favor as a matter of law

dt: {bc}a judgment assigning a value (such as good or bad) to something

shortdef: a judgment assigning a value (such as good or bad) to something

dt: {bc}contrary to what one thinks is best

dt.t: I agreed to let him join us, even though it was {it}against my better judgment{/it}.

shortdef: contrary to what one thinks is best

dt: {bc}to cause someone to be unable to think clearly

dt.t: The alcohol must have {it}clouded my judgment{/it}.

shortdef: to cause someone to be unable to think clearly

dt.t: The company has admitted that it made an {it}error in judgment{/it} in trying to expand too quickly.
It would be premature to {it}pass judgment on{/it} his place in history.
